dev.repos

Class PetSQLRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.repos.PetSQLRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>

    public class PetSQLRepository
extends java.lang.Object
implements Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
    Project 1:

    The PetSQLRepository class serves to collect, manipulate and persist data brought in from a AWS RDB hosted Postgresql database used as the main method of data storage for Project 1's local shelter system. This Repository subclass is the main force behind the collection, manipulation and persisting of the database contents and will run most of the background activity as commissioned through user input in the ShelterApplication class. This will only work with Pets and integers as a primary key.

    Created:
    25 April 2020, Barthelemy Martinon
    With assistance from: August Duet
    Modifications:
    25 April 2020, Barthelemy Martinon, Created class. Prototyped findByID, finaAll, save and delete methods with current projected idea of structure based around current Pet design.

      • findById

        public Pet findById(java.lang.Integer integer)
        Takes the database content, runs a hard-coded SELECT SQL query with WHERE clause to search for an entry with the specified integer for idnum. Returns null is nothing is found.
        Specified by:
        findById in interface Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        pet Pet with target idnum (or null)

      • findAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pet> findAll()
        Takes the database content, runs a hard-coded SELECT SQL query to obtain all entries. Entries are scanned for a specific value under itemType to be "translated" into an instance of the appropriate Pet subclass with the Pet information as parameter inputs. All "translated" entries are put into an ArrayList of pets, which is returned to for ShelterApplication interaction.
        Specified by:
        findAll in interface Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        pets Pet ArrayList of all database rows.

      • save

        public java.lang.Integer save(Pet obj)
        Takes a newly created Pet from the ShelterApplication, and runs a hard-coded INSERT SQL statement to add the Pet into the database as a table entry. Information found within the Pet given as input is collected and converted into the necessary values needed to complete the INSERT statement.
        Specified by:
        save in interface Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        obj - New Pet created by user
        Returns:
        statement.executeUpdate(sql) Integer value representing the amount of rows affected by the statement.

      • update

        public void update(Pet newObj,
                   java.lang.Integer integer)
        Takes a Pet with updated information and an Integer that represents a target Pet's ID number and search through the animals table for a match. If one is found, the new Pet information overrides the target's information. If none are found, nothing happens.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        newObj - Pet to be updated
        integer - Integer value representing target Pet ID

      • delete

        public void delete(Pet obj)
        Takes a Pet from the ShelterApplication and runs a hard-coded DELETE SQL statement to remove the entry from the database.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface Repository<Pet,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        obj - Pet to be removed
